intro: Lorostemon coelhoi, commonly known as the Coelho's lorostemon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
